DataElement.preferredName: Submitted Tumor Tissue Prior Resection Extent Post Operative Imaging Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text field to capture the extent of the resection,  based on post-operative imaging, prior to the operation that yielded the submitted sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Submitted Tumor Tissue Prior Resection Extent Post Operative Imaging
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something._A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._Occurring during or associated with a surgical procedure._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Earlier in time or order._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.:A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Property.preferredName: Post Operative Imaging Technique Prior Excision Extent
Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:Occurring during or associated with a surgical procedure.:Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:Earlier in time or order.:The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ. :The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Occurring during or associated with a surgical procedure.
Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text that provides a description of a topic.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
